name: Twice-Cooked Crispy Fried Tofu
author: earthmotherfromnj
summary: When I can't get kosher meat, I simply do without but today I just craved something meaty. I had a pack of extra-firm tofu in the fridge and this is what I did with it. Baking the tofu before frying helps to crisp it up and imparts the meatiness I was seeking. My BFF thought it was fish at first glance. He is not into foreign foods but he was very enthusiastic about these yummy little bites when served with dipping sauce.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package extra firm tofu, drained
salt and ground black pepper to taste
¼ teaspoon seasoned salt (such as LAWRY'S®)
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Pat tofu dry with a paper towel
Cut each half into 1/4-inch pieces, about 14 pieces in total
Place tofu between paper towels and drain, about 20 minutes
Season tofu with salt and pepper
Mix cornstarch, paprika, thyme, and seasoned salt together to make cornstarch seasoning
Pat any excess moisture off the tofu
Sprinkle cornstarch seasoning evenly over top
Bake in the preheated oven until tofu starts to brown, about 7 minutes
Turn over and continue baking until the upper side is darkened, about 3 minutes more
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Add tofu and fry until golden-brown, about 2 minutes per side
